comments:
Driver : Eclipse 3.1M6, emf I200505050300, wtp-1.0M4
JVM : IBM 1.4.2 SR1a
Platform : SLES 9 sp1 ja_JP.UTF-8 locale

steps
follow the tutorials at 
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/wst/components/wsdl/tutorials/WSDLEditorTutoria
l.html
1. Create a WSDL file
2. edit it (e.g. rename the port Type to EmployeeInfoById)
3. Save

Result
a window User Operations is Waiting pop up, it took around five minutes to 
complete the save. There was no error stack.
Hi Fuse-san, please assign this to rmah@ca.ibm.com. Thanks.
This problem still exits in I20050526 driver.

Hi Masayuki,

I have been unable to reproduce the problem.
Could you please provide more information.
Please send me the file you used as well.

thanks.

I've found that this slow down issue happened by a non root user on SLES9.

Here is the detail steps.
-launch eclipse with -consolelog option
-Create simple project with name "WSDL Example"
-Select the project, then select a WSDL wizard from New > Other..., XML > WSDL 
of the context menu
-Click NEXT, change the name to Employee.wsdl, NEXT, accept default option, 
then Finish
-At the WSDL design view, rename "NewOperation" of Employee at Port Types 
to "EmployeeInfoById".
-Save the file

Following error was shown at the console (this error came up for root user as 
well)

Changed Version field given new release numbering.

Below are exchanges via email:

Hi Lawrence,

We're seeing problems when a validate is being done on a WSDL file when the 
internet is unavailable.  Here are the steps to reproduce:
1)unplug the ethernet cable from the Linux machine
2)launch wtp and open a WSDL file.
3)validate the WSDL file
or
modify and save the WSDL file
or
simply close the workbench

In all of the above scenarios, a Job is waiting to be completed before we can 
continue.  It appears the validation invokes the SAXParser which eventually
leads to attempted access to the internet.  When it runs into problems, we 
don't come out of it cleanly.

Masayuki and Jeffrey, I have been able to reproduce this without specifying the 
Japanese Locale.

Below is the trace when I paused the runtime workbench while it was 'hanging':

Inet4AddressImpl.lookupAllHostAddr(String) line: not available [native method]

This has been reproduced on SLES9 and RHEL.

Note, this only occurs if the ethernet is unplugged from the machine.  If the 
ethernet is deactived through the OS (and not unplugged), it does not hang.
This is confirmed on RHEL

thanks.

Richard

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Richard,
Yes, my SLES9 machine had a working internet connection all the time. That's 
strange...

Best regards, Masayuki Fuse

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Masayuki,

Lawrence Mandel is currently working on a fix for the problem I described (when 
the ethernet cable is unplugged).  Let's see if this fix will also resolve your
problem (when there is a valid connection) since I have not been able to 
reproduce your problem.

thanks.

Richard

Richard, the delay in saving (due to validation) is not limited to WSDL  
validation. The XML validator suffers from the same problem as I assume many  
of the tools due. The problem in this case is a delay while an attempted  
network connection times out. This is consistenly 40 seconds on my machine. I  
don't think there's much we can do about this as this seems to be a limitation  
of the platform that it doesn't correctly determine that there is no network 
connection when the ethernet cable has been unplugged.  
  
However, I don't think this is the cause of Masayuki's problem as Masayuki has  
a network connection.   
  
Masayuki - This problem shouldn't be as severe now that the WSDL schemas are 
included in the XML catalog.  Do you experience the same problem on WTP RC1?

If this code may run for 40 sec, can we move it to a background job? Or can we 
pop up a dialog with 2 buttons: "Run in background" and "Cancel"? Let the user 
decide what to do.

Jeff, two comments: 
 
1. The code is distributed in several places. The cache can be changed to 
timeout sooner but Xerces contains resolution code we cannot change. 
 
2. Validation operations can run in the background but save operations cannot. 
A possible workaround is for the editors to call validation in a background 
job after saving a file rather than waiting on validation to finish the save 
operation. 
Richard, comments?

Sounds fair. Save should be sequential and validation can probably run in the 
background. Also, do we know if 40 sec delay is happening in Eclipse code or 
JRE code?

Jeff, as Richard's stack trace above shows, the delay is occurring in 

Inet4AddressImpl.lookupAllHostAddr(String) line: not available [native method]

which I believe is part of the JRE.

I see a couple of problems with the sequential save, then validate in 
background fix.
1)Let's say we do a save, then a validate in the background (40 secs).  This 
would solve the save taking too long problem on the WSDL, but other user tasks 
which requires the background work to finish would still see the delay.  For 
examlpe editing a simple text file then saving it (after editing and saving the 
WSDL file).

2)There is a scenario where the validation is initiated before the user 
actually does a save.  The wsdl source/text editor attempts to process the 
dirty regions when an edit occurs (sse).  This eventually calls validation.  
When a save is attempted, we have to wait for this validation (40 sec) to 
finish.
Another scenario is the WSDL file is edited, wsdl source/text editor attempts 
to process the dirty regions (40 secs), then the user immediately tries to 
close down Eclipse (without saving the WSDL file).  Again, the user would need 
to wait until the 40 sec. task is complete.

Seems like running it in the background will cause other headaches.

Richard,

1)Why would other tasks see the delay? Can't the validation be done using an
async, non-blocking job? Why does validation of one resource preclude another
resource from being saved? (There may be good reasons here I'd just like to
spell them out.)

2)>There is a scenario where the validation is initiated before the user 
actually does a save.  
This is the behaviour I think should be changed. Validation should be run in an
async thread and simply report back to the editor when complete. The editor
should not block waiting for validation to complete but rather should just
update markers and squiggles when prompted to do so.
>Another scenario is the WSDL file is edited, wsdl source/text editor attempts 
>to process the dirty regions (40 secs), then the user immediately tries to 
>close down Eclipse (without saving the WSDL file).  
This scenario is trickier but can be handled by either adding a 40 sec delay to
the closing of Eclipse in this atypical circumstance or declaring that the
validation job does not need to complete if Eclipse is closing. (I'm not sure if
the jobs API provides a way to handle my second suggestion. If not, this may
make a good candidate for an addition to the jobs API.)

I've confirmed that my problem was not reproducible in WTP-sdk-0.7RC1, EMF/XSD 
2.1.0, Eclipse 3.1, IBM JVM 1.4.2 SR2 on SLES9 and also RHEL4 and Windows.

Lawrence,

1)You're correct, the first point shouldn't be a problem.
2)I agree the editor shouldn't be waiting for the validation to complete.  It 
should update it's red squiggles when the validation reports back.
3)I prefer the validation not having to complete when Eclipse is shutting down.
Thanks.

In comment #20, Masayuki said that he cannot reproduce his problem on 0.7 RC1.
I'm resolving this bug as fixed. Please reopen if the problem reappears.
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).
Closing as I've not seen in 1.5.
